intro: Gonzalagunia chionea, commonly known as the white-flowered gonzalagunia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Gonzalagunia chionea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
